p: DENV-2 RNA was detected in five patients sampled in Taita–Taveta. The patients’ travel history implied that most of these infections could have originated in Mombasa (3/5) or Nairobi (1/5). One of the DENV-2 RNA positive patients was sampled in Mwatate and had not travelled in the preceding month. This would be compatible with local transmission of DENV-2 in the region. Interestingly, Aedes ( Stegomyia) aegypti, which has been mainly associated with urban settlements in Kenya [ 16, 18], was repeatedly observed in some villages of Taita–Taveta County [ 46]. Our ongoing studies of the local mosquitoes may provide further evidence of the occurrence of the local transmission of DENV in Taita–Taveta.
